spec:
Clarify needed: no implementation-ready spec. Propose adding a marketplace UI card at netnet/cockpit/src/pages/marketplace.tsx and a service at netnet/cockpit/src/services/marketplace.ts with acceptance: page renders, API connected to netnet/regenmind units.
Action: open PR to clarify spec.

Clarify needed: propose implement simple dashboard summary at netnet/cockpit/src/pages/dashboard-summary.tsx and service at netnet/cockpit/src/services/dashboardService.ts. Acceptance: page renders with key metrics.
Commands to run: cd netnet/cockpit && npm ci && npm test || true && npm run build || true

U-034 — Code quality gates (implementation-ready)

Target files to add/change (all under netnet/cockpit/src/):
- .github/workflows/code-quality.yml  # new GitHub Actions workflow
- netnet/cockpit/package.json         # workflow will run commands if this file exists
- netnet/cockpit/.github-ci-scripts/run_tests.sh  # helper script invoked by workflow

Implementation notes (what to implement):
1) Add a GitHub Actions workflow at .github/workflows/code-quality.yml that triggers on pull_request targeting test-vealth-branch and on push to feature/*.
   - Job matrix: node (16 or latest LTS)
   - Steps:
     a) checkout
     b) cd netnet/cockpit
     c) run npm ci
     d) if "npm test" script exists in package.json, run npm test (capture output)
     e) if "lint" script exists, run npm run lint
     f) if "build" script exists, run npm run build
   - Save logs as workflow job output; annotate failing steps.
2) Add helper script netnet/cockpit/.github-ci-scripts/run_tests.sh that runs the above commands idempotently and prints clear markers for each step (e.g., "=== NPM TEST START ===").

Acceptance checklist (DONE criteria):
- The workflow file exists at .github/workflows/code-quality.yml in the repository.
- On creation of a test PR (this PR), the workflow runs and completes, producing logs for each step.
- If tests/lint/build are absent (no package.json or no scripts), the workflow should skip corresponding steps without failing; logs should show "SKIPPED: <step>".
- Document the steps in netnet/cockpit/CI_README.md describing how to run locally.

Commands to run (for developer verification):
- From repo root: cd netnet/cockpit && npm ci && npm test || true && npm run lint || true && npm run build || true
- Paste full stdout/stderr from the above commands into the PR body under "Build/Test/Lint output".

Rollback / safety notes:
- The workflow is non-destructive; it only runs CI commands. If it causes unexpected load, we can disable it by removing or renaming the workflow file.
- No secrets are added. Ensure workflow does not echo any secrets.

Implement U-035 focused on making cockpit usable and integrated.
- Target files (must edit): netnet/cockpit/src/u_035.tsx (or .ts/.tsx), plus supporting modules under netnet/cockpit/src/u_035_service.ts
- Acceptance checklist:
  1) Code compiles (npm run build in netnet/cockpit if package.json exists)
  2) Unit or integration tests under tests/u_035_test.py or cockpit tests pass
  3) Manual verification steps listed below pass
- Commands to run (from repo root):
  cd netnet/cockpit && npm ci && npm run lint || true && npm test || true && npm run build || true
  Paste console output under PR body "Build/Test/Lint output"
- Manual verification (Done when):
  - The feature is reachable in the cockpit UI at path /u_035
  - The UI shows expected elements and behaviour (describe in acceptance details)
- Rollback/safety:
  - Feature behind feature flag in cockpit config if high-risk
  - Ensure no secrets are committed

Acceptance details:
 - Update or create React component under netnet/cockpit/src/components/u_035.tsx
 - Add route in netnet/cockpit/src/pages/u_035.tsx

Code quality gates: Run npm test / npm run lint / npm run build when available; post results in events.
UI/UX design system pass: Make cockpit “calm, dense, usable": consistent components, spacing, typography, status badges.
Work templates library: Job templates: deploy, revenue-idea spec, content pack, lead pack, automation sprint. Phase D — Revenue programs + regen receipts
Revenue program: Content Pack: Run v1 Inputs → outputs artifact bundle (hooks/captions/scripts) stored and linked.
Revenue program: Lead Pack: Run v1 CSV output + outreach copy + tracking fields.
Net Benefit Receipt enforcement: DONE requires completion bundle: Value Delivered + Receipt (or PENDING) + Next Run Recommendation.
Deploy Netnet stable URL: HTTPS + reverse proxy; Systemd/pm2, nginx, domain, TLS, protected endpoints.
Auth / operator key: Simple header token or basic auth for destructive endpoints (worker trigger, seeding).
Autonomy modes: UI + policy envelope OFF / PROPOSE / EXECUTE, caps, allowlists, kill switch shown in cockpit.
Execution Adapter Layer: Abstract execution target in worker: "local" or "conway". All job execution routes through this adapter boundary.
Conway Remote Compute Adapter: Implement Conway as controlled remote executor: provision sandbox, run command, capture output, post event.
Resource & Spend Guardrails: Enforce per-job limits: max runtime, max spend, approval flag required, visible policy in cockpit.
Operator layout overflow + sticky composer: Fix hidden buttons / reachability
Kindergarten mode toggle: tooltips + simplified labels + guided next action
VEALTH_SYSTEM.md + System viewer: in-app "System" viewer tab (agent + human share the same truth)
